section.title: Purpose
section.p: Restore all documents removed previously using the /TASK=REMOVEDOCS function.

refsyn.title: Format
refsyn.p: The following syntax diagram describes how you delete documents with the OTMBATCH command. Note that lowercase letters in a parameter name are optional and need not be typed.

section.title: Parameters

plentry.pd: RESTOREDOCS specifies that you want to remove documents.
Specifies the name of the folder that contains the documents to be removed.

If you specify the parameter in this format, you are not prompted with any message window. If you do not specify any of the /quiet paramaters, a message window pops up whenever an error occurs or when the task has successfully completed.
If you specify this parameter, you are not prompted with any message window. Any error message text is routed to stdout.

section.note: You can type the commands in uppercase, lowercase, or in mixed-case letters. You may not use any wildcard characters, such as an asterisk (*).

example.title: Examples
example.p: The following example shows how to delete documents using the OTMBATCH command.
In this example, all previously removed documents of folder pharma are restored.
